prequal_self_describe: How will you be participating in the RARE-X Data Collection Platform?
prequal_self_describe_p:
If you already have a RARE-X account, please log in HERE.
If you are registering for the first time, please continue with the questions below to create an account.
prequal_self_describe_exp: The following questions are used to determine which consent process to use.
prequal_child_diagnosed: I'm a parent/legal guardian of someone who has A-T.
prequal_stay_informed: I'm not registering a participant but I would like to stay informed about this initiative.
prequal_req_hint: Please choose one of the above options.
diagnosis_dyrk1: DYRK1A - dual-specificity tyrosine phosphorylation regulated kinase 1A
diagnosis_dada2: DADA2 (deficiency of the enzyme ADA2 (Adenosine Deaminase 2)
diagnosis_smard: SMARD (Spinal Muscular Atrophy with Respiratory Distress)
add_participant_prompt_relationship: Choose option that best describes your relationship with the patient
add_participant_child_cognitively_capabl: Is the patient able to understand use of their information for research and agree to participate themselves?
add_participant_legal_authority: Do you have the legal authority (such as legal guardianship) to make decisions on behalf of the patient?
add_participant_country_governed: Where does the person with the rare disorder (“patient”) currently live? *
add_participant_primary_diagnosis_explan: You will have an opportunity to list all the diagnoses later in the surveys.
add_participant_child_primary_diagnosis: What is the patient's primary diagnosis? *
consent_summary_created: Please sign the Research Consent Form, which will allow RARE-X to obtain biospecimen samples, copies of your medical records, and opt-in to share blood samples and/or other biosamples.
consent_summary_in_progress: Please finish reviewing and signing the Research Consent Form.
consent_summary_complete: Thank you for signing the Research Consent Form.
consent_signature_middle_name: Your middle/second or additional (if you have one) name
consent_signature_middle_name_exp: Your complete middle/second or additional name
consent_blind_question: Will someone else be reading the consent to you because you are not able to read it yourself (for example, because you are blind)?
consent_witness_signature_title: Witness Signature for Participants Who Cannot Read
consent_witness_signature_body: The study participant has indicated that he/she is unable to read. The consent document has been read to the participant by a member of the study staff, discussed with the participant by a member of the study staff, and the participant has been given an opportunity to ask questions of the study staff.
consent_lar_authority: Indicate the legally authorized representative’s authority to act for the participant:
consent_lar_authority_parent: Parent of adult participant (18 years of age or over)
consent_lar_authority_adult_child: Adult child (18 years of age or over) for his or her parent
consent_lar_authority_adult_sibling: Adult sibling (18 years of age or over) for his or her sibling
consent_lar_authority_adult_grandchild: Adult grandchild (18 years of age or over) for his or her grandparent
consent_lar_authority_guardian: Guardian appointed to make medical decisions for individuals who are incapacitated
lar_consent_child_firstname_validation_h: Participant's first name cannot be empty
lar_consent_child_firstname_exp: Participant's complete legal given (first) name at birth
lar_consent_child_lastname_validation_hi: Participant's last name cannot be empty
lar_consent_child_lastname_exp: Participant's complete legal family (last) name at birth
lar_consent_child_middlename: Participant's middle/second or additional (if the participant has one) name
lar_consent_child_middlename_exp: Participant's complete middle/second or additional name
parental_consent_child_firstname: Your child’s complete legal given (first) name *
parental_consent_child_firstname_validat: Child's first name cannot be empty
parental_consent_child_firstname_exp: Your child’s complete legal given (first) name at birth
parental_consent_child_lastname: Your child’s complete legal family (last) name *
parental_consent_child_lastname_validati: Child's last name cannot be empty
parental_consent_child_lastname_exp: Your child’s complete legal family (last) name at birth
parental_consent_child_middlename: Your child's middle/second or additional (if your child has one) name
parental_consent_child_middlename_exp: Your child’s complete middle/second or additional name
parental_consent_parent_last_name_exp: Your complete legal last (family) name at birth
parental_consent_parent_middle_name: Your middle/second or additional (if you have one) name
parental_consent_parent_middle_name_exp: Your complete middle/second or additional name
parental_assent_child_firstname: Your child’s complete legal first (given) name *
parental_assent_child_firstname_validati: Child's first name cannot be empty
parental_assent_child_firstname_exp: Your child’s complete legal first (given) name
parental_assent_child_lastname: Your child’s complete legal last (family) name *
parental_assent_child_lastname_validatio: Child's last name cannot be empty
parental_assent_child_lastname_exp: Your child’s complete legal last (family) name
parental_assent_child_middlename: Your child's middle/second or additional (if your child has one) name
parental_assent_child_middlename_exp: Your child’s complete middle/second or additional name
general_information_summary_created: Please answer the General Information Survey.
general_information_summary_in_progress: Please finish answering the General Information Survey.
general_information_summary_complete: Thank you for answering the General Information Survey.
general_information_verify_your_info: Please verify the following information about yourself:
general_information_verify_patient_info: Please verify the following information about the patient:
general_information_complete_information: Please complete the following information about yourself:
general_information_middle_name: Your middle/second or additional (If you have one) name
general_information_middle_name_exp: Your complete middle/second or additional name
general_information_patient_first_name: The patient's complete legal first (given) name *
general_information_patient_first_name_e: The patient's complete legal first (given) name
general_information_patient_last_name: The patient's complete legal last (family) name *
general_information_patient_last_name_ex: The patient's complete legal last (family) name
general_information_patient_middle_name: The patient's middle/second or additional (If they have one) name
general_information_patient_middle_name_: The patient's complete middle/second or additional name
general_information_name_different: Was your name different at birth? *
general_information_name_different_exp: Name change could be for marriage, adoption, personal choice, etc.
general_information_patient_name_differe: Was the patient’s name different at birth? *
This could be marriage, adoption, personal choice, etc.
general_information_first_name_at_b_exp: Your complete legal first (given) name at birth
general_information_last_name_at_b_exp: Your complete legal last (family) name at birth
general_information_middle_name_at_b_exp: Your complete middle/second or additional name at birth
general_information_patient_first_name_a: The patient’s complete legal first (given) name at birth
general_information_patient_last_name_at: The patient’s complete legal last (family) name at birth
general_information_patient_middle_name_: The patient’s complete middle/second or additional name at birth
general_information_primary_lang_prompt: What is the primary language you speak?*
general_information_patient_primary_lang: What is the primary language the patient speaks?*
general_information_mailing_address_subt: We are asking this in the event that a researcher or organization wants to collect biospecimens (spit, blood, skin, etc) in the future, so we can mail the sample collection kit to you. Please list an address where you wish to receive a kit.
general_information_birthplace_header_ex: The following questions are used to create the unique codes for your data.
general_information_patient_birthplace_h: The following questions are used to create the unique codes for the data provided.
general_information_municipality_placeho: Name of the city/municipality where you were born *
general_information_day_of_birth_hint: Date of birth cannot be empty.
general_information_month_of_birth_hint: Month of birth cannot be empty.
general_information_year_of_birth_hint: Year of birth cannot be empty.
general_information_questions_about_pati: The following questions are about the patient
general_information_sex_prompt: What was your biological sex at birth? *
general_information_patient_sex_prompt: What was the patient's biological sex at birth? *
general_information_gender_identity: What term best describes your gender identity? *
general_information_patient_gender_ident: What term best describes the patient's gender identity? *
general_information_gender_identity_boy: Man (or boy, if patient is a child)
general_information_gender_identity_girl: Woman (or girl, if patient is a child)
general_information_gender_identity_none: None of these describe me, and I’d like to describe myself
general_information_race_exp: Select all that apply, and/or select "Other" to specify any other races.
general_information_race_native_hawaiian: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
general_information_annual_income: What is your best estimate of the total income of all family members who live in your house from all sources, before taxes, in the last calendar year? *
general_information_patient_annual_incom: What is your best estimate of the total income of all family members who live in the patient's house from all sources, before taxes, in the last calendar year? *
general_information_marital_status: What is your current relationship/marital status?
general_information_health_insurance_cov: Are you covered by health insurance or some other kind of health care plan? *
general_information_patient_health_insur: Is the patient covered by health insurance or some other kind of health care plan? *
general_information_health_insurance_cov: This is just to look at insurance coverage in rare disease in general, NOT to track insurance details.
general_information_hic_not_to_answer_de: What type(s) of coverage do you have?*
For health insurance coverage outside the USA, please select the categories that most closely describe the source of the participant's health insurance.
single_service_plan: Single service plan (e.g. dental, vision, prescription)
general_information_patient_country_birt: Country/Territory where the patient was born *
general_information_patient_city_birthpl: City/Municipality where the patient was born *
general_information_patient_state_birthp: State/Province (or other applicable region) where the patient was born *
health_and_development_summary_created: Please fill out the Health and Development Survey.
health_and_development_summary_in_progre: Almost done. Please finish the Health and Development Survey.
health_and_development_summary_complete: Thank you for answering the Health and Development Survey.
h_d_reach_to_parents: For the following questions, you may need to contact your parents, if possible.
h_d_reach_to_patient_parents: For the following questions, if you are not the parent, you may need to contact the patient's parents, if possible.
h_d_answer_according_to_you: For the following questions, please answer according to you. You do not have to have an official diagnosis. You will be able to give more details about your answers in later surveys.
h_d_patient_answer_according_to_you: For the following questions, please answer according to you. There does not have to be an official diagnosis. You will be able to give more details about the patient's answers in later surveys.
h_d_diagnoses: General health and development questions were asked in this survey. To help RARE-X identify and prioritize future focused groups of questions, please provide ALL known patient conditions/diagnoses/genetic diagnoses below (one patient condition/diagnosis/genetic diagnosis per line). If the patient is undiagnosed, please list "undiagnosed".*
h_d_parent_genetic_tested: Did the patient have genetic testing?*
h_d_genetic_test_reason: What was the reason for your genetic testing?*
h_d_parent_genetic_test_reason: What was the reason for genetic testing?*
h_d_genetic_test_reports: For the conditions you listed above do you have reports or summaries to upload as support?*
h_d_genetic_test_reports_exp: ** Instructions for uploading a copy of your genetic test report(s) will be provided after you complete this survey.
h_d_pregnancy_issues: Have you been told that there were issues during <u>your biological mother's</u> PREGNANCY with you and/or your DELIVERY/BIRTH?*
h_d_patient_pregnancy_issues: Have you been told that there were issues during <u>the patient's biological mother's</u> PREGNANCY with the patient and/or the patient DELIVERY/BIRTH?*
h_d_pregnancy_issues_exp: Examples: Mother had to be put on bed rest, there were concerns on ultrasound, you were born early (prematurely), or you had to stay in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU).
h_d_patient_pregnancy_issues_exp: Examples: Mother had to be put on bed rest, there were concerns on ultrasound, the patient was born early (prematurely), or the patient had to stay in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU).
h_d_labor_issues: Were there any issues during the labor and delivery?*
h_d_patient_labor_issues: Were there any issues during the labor and delivery?*
h_d_labor_issues_exp: Examples: You were born early (prematurely), or you had to stay in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU).
h_d_patient_labor_issues_exp: Examples: The patient was born early (prematurely), or had to stay in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU).
h_d_growth_issues: Have you had issues with your GROWTH?*
h_d_patient_growth_issues: Has the patient had issues with GROWTH?*
h_d_growth_issues_exp: Examples: You are much shorter or taller than expected for your family, you have had significant and/or lifelong problems gaining weight, or you have significant and/or lifelong problems with obesity. You may have seen an endocrinologist or other specialist for these issues.
h_d_patient_growth_issues_exp: Examples: You are much shorter or taller than expected for your family, you have had significant and/or lifelong problems gaining weight, or you have significant and/or lifelong problems with obesity. They may have seen an endocrinologist or other specialist for these issues.
h_d_behavior_issues: Have you had BEHAVIOR and/or PSYCHIATRIC issues?*
h_d_patient_behavior_issues: Has `the pat`ient had BEHAVIOR and/or PSYCHIATRIC issues?*
h_d_behavior_issues_exp: Examples: Autism spectrum disorders, schizophrenia, anxiety, aggression, repetitive behaviors, and depression. You may have seen a developmental pediatrician, psychologist, psychiatrist, or therapist for these issues.
h_d_patient_behavior_issues_exp: Examples: Autism spectrum disorders, schizophrenia, anxiety, aggression, repetitive behaviors, and depression. They may have seen a developmental pediatrician, psychologist, psychiatrist, or therapist for these issues.
h_d_brain_issues: Have you had issues with BRAIN and/or NERVOUS SYSTEM (neurological issues)?*
h_d_brain_issues_exp: Examples: Seizures, epilepsy, developmental delays, intellectual disability, learning problems, significant problems with muscle tone, cerebral palsy, or problems with brain structure. You may have seen a neurologist for these issues.
h_d_patient_brain_issues: Has the patient had issues with BRAIN and/or NERVOUS SYSTEM (neurological issues)?*
h_d_patient_brain_issues_exp: Examples: Seizures, epilepsy, developmental delays, intellectual disability, learning problems, significant problems with muscle tone, cerebral palsy, or problems with brain structure. They may have seen a neurologist for these issues.
h_d_cancer_issues: Have you ever been diagnosed with CANCER, COLON POLYPS or a NON-CANCEROUS TUMOR?*
h_d_cancer_issues_exp: Examples: Breast cancer, prostate cancer, skin cancer, lung cancer. You may have seen an oncologist for these issues.
h_d_patient_cancer_issues: Has the patient ever been diagnosed with CANCER, COLON POLYPS or a NON-CANCEROUS TUMOR?*
h_d_patient_cancer_issues_exp: Examples: Breast cancer, prostate cancer, skin cancer, lung cancer. They may have seen an oncologist for these issues.
h_d_head_neck_issues: Have you had issues with your HEAD/FACE/NECK?*
h_d_head_neck_issues_exp: Please note that we are asking you about SIGNIFICANT issues with these areas, problems that you have seen a doctor for or had surgery for, or problems that you don't notice often in other people. The doctor may have used the term “dysmorphic” in describing some features of your face. Examples: Cleft lip/palate, large or small head size, fused skull bones, sparse hair, etc. We will ask specifically about eyes and ears later.
h_d_patient_head_neck_issues: Has the patient had issues with their HEAD/FACE/NECK?*
h_d_patient_head_neck_issues_exp: Please note that we are asking about SIGNIFICANT issues with these areas, problems that the patient has seen a doctor for or had surgery for, or problems that you don't notice often in other people. The doctor may have used the term “dysmorphic” in describing some features of the patient’s face. Examples: Cleft lip/palate, large or small head size, fused skull bones, sparse hair, etc. We will ask specifically about eyes and ears later.
h_d_eyes_issues: Have you had issues with your EYES and/or VISION?*
h_d_eyes_issues_exp: Examples: Vision loss, cataracts, a “lazy eye,” nearsighted- or farsightedness. You may have seen an optometrist or ophthalmologist (eye doctors) for these issues.
h_d_patient_eyes_issues: Has the patient had issues with their EYES and/or VISION?*
h_d_patient_eyes_issues_exp: Examples: Vision loss, cataracts, a “lazy eye,” nearsighted- or farsightedness. They may have seen an optometrist or ophthalmologist (eye doctors) for these issues.
h_d_ears_issues: Have you had issues with your EARS and/or HEARING?*
h_d_ears_issues_exp: Examples: Hearing loss, ringing in the ears, or misshapen ears. You may have seen an audiologist or Ears/Nose/Throat (ENT) doctor for these issues.
h_d_patient_ears_issues: Has the patient had issues with their EARS and/or HEARING?*
h_d_patient_ears_issues_exp: Examples: Hearing loss, ringing in the ears, or misshapen ears. They may have seen an audiologist or Ears/Nose/Throat (ENT) doctor for these issues.
h_d_skin_issues: Have you had issues with your SKIN?*
h_d_skin_issues_exp: Examples: Unusual skin coloration, lumps or bumps that needed to be looked at by a doctor, or sweating issues. You may have seen a dermatologist for these issues.
h_d_patient_skin_issues: Has the patient had issues with their SKIN?*
h_d_patient_skin_issues_exp: Examples: Unusual skin coloration, lumps or bumps that needed to be looked at by a doctor, or sweating issues. They may have seen a dermatologist for these issues.
h_d_bones_issues: Have you had issues with your BONES, CARTILAGE, and/or CONNECTIVE TISSUE?*
h_d_bones_issues_exp: Examples: Issues with easily broken bones, extreme flexibility, or the look/use of your arms, legs, hands, and/or feet. You may have seen an orthopedist or other special doctor for these issues.
h_d_patient_bones_issues: Has the patient had issues with their BONES, CARTILAGE, and/or CONNECTIVE TISSUE?*
h_d_patient_bones_issues_exp: Examples: Issues with easily broken bones, extreme flexibility, or the look/use of the patient’s arms, legs, hands, and/or feet. They may have seen an orthopedist or other special doctor for these issues.
h_d_muscles_issues: Have you had issues with your MUSCLES?*
h_d_muscles_issues_exp: Examples: Significant issues with the way your muscles are formed or the way they work, including muscle weakness, burning, or stiffness. You may have seen a neurologist, orthopedist, or other special doctor for these issues.
h_d_patient_muscles_issues: Has the patient had issues with their MUSCLES?*
h_d_patient_muscles_issues_exp: Examples: Significant issues with the way the patient’s muscles are formed or the way they work, including muscle weakness, burning, or stiffness. They may have seen a neurologist, orthopedist, or other special doctor for these issues.
h_d_heart_issues: Have you had issues with your HEART and/or BLOOD VESSELS?*
h_d_heart_issues_exp: Examples: Cardiomyopathy, heart defects needing surgery, widened/bulging blood vessel, or problems with heart rhythm. You may have seen a cardiologist for these issues.
h_d_patient_heart_issues: Has the patient had issues with their HEART and/or BLOOD VESSELS?*
h_d_patient_heart_issues_exp: Examples: Cardiomyopathy, heart defects needing surgery, widened/bulging blood vessel, or problems with heart rhythm. They may have seen a cardiologist for these issues.
h_d_lungs_issues: Have you had issues with your LUNGS and/or BREATHING?*
h_d_lungs_issues_exp: Examples: A collapsed lung, fluid on the lungs, or apnea. You may have seen a pulmonologist for these issues.
h_d_patient_lungs_issues: Has the patient had issues with their LUNGS and/or BREATHING?*
h_d_patient_lungs_issues_exp: Examples: A collapsed lung, fluid on the lungs, or apnea. They may have seen a pulmonologist for these issues.
h_d_digest_issues: Have you had issues with your DIGESTIVE SYSTEM?*
h_d_digest_issues_exp:
Includes stomach, intestines, or other parts of gastrointestinal (GI) tract.
Examples: Issues with the structure or use of your stomach or intestines, extreme issues with constipation, reflux, and/or vomiting. You may have seen a GI (gastrointestinal) doctor for these issues.
h_d_patient_digest_issues: Has the patient had issues with their DIGESTIVE SYSTEM?*
h_d_patient_digest_issues_exp:
Includes stomach, intestines, or other parts of gastrointestinal (GI) tract.
Examples: Issues with the structure or use of your stomach or intestines, extreme issues with constipation, reflux, and/or vomiting. You may have seen a GI (gastrointestinal) doctor for these issues.
h_d_hormones_issues: Have you had issues with your HORMONES and/or ENDOCRINE SYSTEM (hormone-producing glands)?*
h_d_hormones_issues_exp: Examples: Diabetes, issues with estrogen or testosterone levels, or function of the thyroid, parathyroid, or adrenal glands. You may have seen an endocrinologist for these issues.
h_d_patient_hormones_issues: Has the patient had issues with their HORMONES and/or ENDOCRINE SYSTEM (hormone-producing glands)?*
h_d_patient_hormones_issues_exp: Examples: Diabetes, issues with estrogen or testosterone levels, or function of the thyroid, parathyroid, or adrenal glands. You may have seen an endocrinologist for these issues.
h_d_genitals_issues: Have you had issues with your KIDNEYS, BLADDER, and/or GENITALS (male/female reproductive parts)?*
h_d_genitals_issues_exp: Examples: Issues with urination, kidneys, or reproductive system, including concerns about how these body parts look or work. Some specific examples are hypospadias, kidney failure, infertility, and incontinence. You may have seen a nephrologist, urologist, gynecologist, or other special doctor for these issues.
h_d_patient_genitals_issues: Has the patient had issues with their KIDNEYS, BLADDER, and/or GENITALS (male/female reproductive parts)?*
h_d_patient_genitals_issues_exp: Examples: Issues with urination, kidneys, or reproductive system, including concerns about how these body parts look or work. Some specific examples are hypospadias, kidney failure, infertility, and incontinence. They may have seen a nephrologist, urologist, gynecologist, or other special doctor for these issues.
h_d_immune_issues: Have you had issues with your IMMUNE SYSTEM?*
h_d_immune_issues_exp: Examples: Frequent infections or immunodeficiency. You may have seen an immunologist for these issues.
h_d_patient_immune_issues: Has the patient had issues with their IMMUNE SYSTEM?*
h_d_patient_immune_issues_exp: Examples: Frequent infections or immunodeficiency. They may have seen an immunologist for these issues.
h_d_blood_issues: Have you had issues with your BLOOD and/or BLEEDING?*
h_d_blood_issues_exp: Examples: Excessive bleeding or problems noted with your blood cells on lab reports. You may have seen a hematologist for these issues.
h_d_patient_blood_issues: Has the patient had issues with their BLOOD and/or BLEEDING?*
h_d_patient_blood_issues_exp: Examples: Excessive bleeding or problems noted with your blood cells on lab reports. They may have seen a hematologist for these issues.
h_d_teeth_issues: Have you had issues with your TEETH or MOUTH?*
h_d_teeth_issues_exp: Examples: physical mouth, lips, tongue or teeth issues or mouth function. You may have seen a dentist for these issues.
h_d_patient_teeth_issues: Has the patient had issues with their TEETH or MOUTH?*
h_d_patient_teeth_issues_exp: Examples: physical mouth, lips, tongue or teeth issues or mouth function. You may have seen a dentist for these issues.
h_d_patient_walk_issues: Is the patient able to walk without assistance?*
h_d_patient_communication: Is the patient able to communicate (either single syllables, verbal words, or sentences)?*
h_d_patient_development_concerns: Were there any concerns about the patient's development?*
h_d_patient_development_concerns_age: How old was the patient when there were first concerns about their development?*
h_d_patient_development_concerns_months: Enter age in months when there were first concerns*
h_d_patient_development_concerns_years: Enter age in years when there were first concerns*
h_d_patient_regression: Have you noticed any loss of skills/regression/decrease in ability (motor, communication, growth, etc)?*
h_d_communication_issues: Compared to other people do you think you have communication issues?*
h_d_communication_issues_exp: Have your parents, doctors or anyone in your life ever felt that there were any concerns, or challenges or accommodations needed or provided for communication?
h_d_learning_differences: Do you or did you have any accommodations because of learning differences?*
h_d_learning_differences_exp: Examples: special placement in school, needing an individualized education plan (IEP), missing grades.
h_d_mobility_issues: According to you, do you have mobility (getting around) issues?*
h_d_mobility_issues_exp: Examples: Using wheelchair, canes assistive devices.
h_d_sleeping_issues: According to you, do you have sleeping issues?*
h_d_development_issues: According to you, do you/did you have development issues? Did you miss any childhood missed milestones?*
h_d_energy_issues: According to you, do you have energy/activity issues?*
h_d_emotion_issues: According to you, do you have emotion-related issues?*
h_d_development_concerns_age: How old were you when there were first concerns about your development?*
h_d_first_development_concerns: First concerns about development? (select all that apply)*
h_d_concern_focus: More focused on objects or self - minimal interest in other people
h_d_concern_initiate_interaction: Did not initiate or rarely initiated social interaction
h_d_concern_delayed_response: Delayed or absent response to his/her own name - appeared not to hear
h_d_concern_delayed_speaking: Delayed or abnormal babbling or speaking
h_d_concern_repetitive_behavior: Repetitive behaviors - such as hand flapping or rocking
h_d_concern_unusual_intense: Unusually intense interests in certain topics, toys, or activities - such as lining up objects
h_d_concern_unusual_response: Unusual response to touch, taste, smell or sounds
h_d_concern_didnot_imitate: Did not point, gesture or imitate others
h_d_concern_stop_progressing: Stopped progressing in skills/development halted or plateaued
h_d_concern_didnot_need_sleep: Did not need as much sleep as other children of the same age
h_d_concern_abnormal_muscle_tone: Abnormal motor development or muscle tone - unusually stiff or floppy
h_d_concern_others_told_wrong: Other people told me something was wrong
h_d_walk_issues: Are you able to walk without assistance?*
h_d_regression: Have you noticed any loss of skills/regression/decrease in ability (motor, communication, growth, etc)?*
h_d_development_concerns: Concerns about development, select all that apply.*
h_d_genetic_condition_symptom: I have had symptoms of a genetic condition.
h_d_patient_genetic_condition_symptom: The patient has had symptoms of a genetic condition.
h_d_confirm_diagnosis: The doctor/I wanted to confirm a diagnosis that was suspected based on my symptoms.
h_d_patient_confirm_diagnosis: The doctor/I/the patient wanted to confirm a diagnosis that was suspected based on the patient’s symptoms.
h_d_family_history_with_symptoms: I have a family history of a genetic disorder and was showing symptoms of that disorder – wanted to confirm diagnosis.
h_d_patient_family_history_with_symptoms: The patient has a family history of a genetic disorder and was showing symptoms of that disorder – wanted to confirm diagnosis.
h_d_family_history_wo_symptoms: I have a family history of a genetic disorder and was NOT showing symptoms of the disorder – wanted to assess my risk.
h_d_patient_family_history_wo_symptoms: The patient has a family history of a genetic disorder and was NOT showing symptoms of the disorder – wanted to assess the patient’s risk.
h_d_healthy_proactive: I am healthy and wanted to be proactive about my health.
h_d_patient_healthy_proactive: The patient is healthy and wanted to be proactive about the patient’s health.
h_d_report_yes: Yes (I have had testing and have a copy)
h_d_patient_report_yes: Yes (the patient has had testing and I have a copy)
h_d_report_no: No (I have had testing but do NOT have a copy)
h_d_patient_report_no: No (the patient has had testing but I do NOT have a copy)

qol_title_participation: Ability to Participate in Social Roles and Activities
qol_self_chores: Are you able to do chores such as vacuuming or yard work?*
qol_self_stairs: Are you able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace?*
qol_self_walk: Are you able to go for a walk of at least 15 minutes?*
qol_self_errands: Are you able to run errands and shop?*
qol_self_focus: I found it hard to focus on anything other than my anxiety...*
qol_self_trouble_starting: I have trouble starting things because I am tired...*
qol_self_run_down: How run-down did you feel on average?*
qol_self_fatigued_average: How fatigued were you on average?*
qol_self_sleep_problem: I had a problem with my sleep...*
qol_self_trouble_leisure_act: I have trouble doing all of my regular leisure activities with others...*
qol_self_trouble_family_act: I have trouble doing all of the family activities that I want to do...*
qol_self_trouble_work: I have trouble doing all of my usual work (include work at home)...*
qol_self_trouble_friends_act: I have trouble doing all of the activities with friends that I want to do...*
qol_self_pain_daily_activities: How much did pain interfere with your day to day activities?...*
qol_self_pain_work: How much did pain interfere with work around the home?...*
qol_self_pain_social: How much did pain interfere with your ability to participate in social activities?*
qol_self_pain_chores: How much did pain interfere with your household chores?*
qol_self_pain_intensity: On a scale of 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable), how would you rate your pain on average?*
qol_patient_exercise: The patient could do sports and exercise that other people his/her age could do...*
qol_patient_floor: The patient could get up from the floor...*
qol_patient_stairs: The patient could walk up stairs without holding on to anything...*
qol_patient_activities: The patient has been physically able to do the activities he/she enjoys most...
qol_patient_awful: The patient felt like something awful might happen...*
qol_patient_worried_at_home: The patient worried when he/she was at home...*
qol_patient_felt_went_wrong: The patient felt everything in his/her life went wrong...*
qol_patient_hard_to_have_fun: It was hard for the patient to have fun...*
qol_patient_keep_up_with_activities: Being tired made it hard for the patient to keep up with schoolwork/activities of daily living...*
qol_patient_too_tired_for_sports: The patient was too tired to do sports or exercise...*
qol_patient_too_tired_to_enjoy: The patient was too tired to enjoy the things he/she likes to do...*
qol_patient_felt_accepted: The patient felt accepted by other people his/her age...*
qol_patient_able_to_count_on_friends: The patient was able to count on his/her friends...*
qol_patient_friends_help: The patient and his/her friends helped each other out...*
qol_patient_others_want_to_be_friend: Other people wanted to be the patient's friend...*
qol_patient_trouble_sleeping: The patient had trouble sleeping when he/she had pain...*
qol_patient_pay_attention: It was hard for the patient to pay attention when he/she had pain...*
qol_patient_hard_to_run: It was hard for the patient to run when he/she had pain...*
qol_patient_hard_to_walk_one_block: It was hard for the patient to walk one block when he/she had pain...*
qol_patient_pain_intensity: On a scale of 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable), how bad was the patient’s pain on average?*

data_sharing_summary_created: Please fill out the Data Sharing Agreement. This is your chance to choose who can see and analyze your data from the Data Collection Program and other data sources.
data_sharing_summary_in_progress: Not quite done yet. Please finish filling out the Data Sharing Agreement.
data_sharing_summary_complete: Thank you for completing the Data Sharing Agreement.
ds_your_choises_title: Your Choices for Sharing Your DeIdentified Data for Research
ds_text1: You have agreed to share your data for research. Researchers include a wide variety of people who study data for a scientific purpose. Researchers who might use your data include those associated with a university, a healthcare system, or a pharmaceutical (drug) company. These researchers may be developing drugs, medical devices, or non-drug treatments (including behavior treatments, diets, etc.). Also, researchers who might use your data include qualified “citizen scientists.” Citizen scientists have been trained in data use and are part of a patient, academic, or other organization.
ds_text2: You choose the type of research you would like your data to be used for.
ds_text3: You must choose one of the following two types of research:
ds_patient_your_choises_title: Your Choices for Sharing Patient DeIdentified Data for Research
ds_patient_text1: As a legally authorized representative of a patient with a rare disease, you have agreed to share the patient’s data for research. Researchers include a wide variety of people who study data for a scientific purpose. Researchers who might use the patient’s data include those associated with a university, a healthcare system, or a pharmaceutical (drug) company. These researchers may be developing drugs, medical devices, or non-drug treatments (including behavior treatments, diets, etc.). Also, researchers who might use the patient’s data include qualified “citizen scientists.” Citizen scientists have been trained in data use and are part of a patient, academic, or other organization.
ds_patient_text2: You choose the type of research you would like the patient’s data to be used for.
ds_o_text1: You do not have to put any additional limits on how your data is used for research. If this is your choice, you can stop now and go to the end of this form.
ds_o_text2: But if you would like, you may choose to further limit how your data is accessed and used for research. You can select one or both of the options below.
ds_patient_o_text1: You do not have to put any additional limits on how the patient’s data is used for research. If this is your choice, you can stop now and go to the end of this form.
ds_patient_o_text2: But if you would like, you may choose to further limit how the patient’s data is accessed and used for research. You can select one or both options below.
ds_limit_irb: Only research that has been approved by an Institutional Review Board (IRB).
ds_limit_non_commercial_exp: If you choose this limit, it means your data may NOT be used by any researcher to do studies to develop a drug, treatment, or device that might later be sold to make a profit. For example, if you choose this limitation, a drug development company (biotech or pharmaceutical) would not be allowed to access or use your data for research to develop a drug, treatment, or device that they will sell.
ds_limit_irb_exp: If you choose this limit, it means that only researchers that have had their studies reviewed by an Institutional Review Board (IRB) may access your data for their research. An IRB is a type of committee that reviews research studies and methods to make sure they are not harmful to people. Most of the people who are on an IRB have professional expertise to be able to review the research. The IRB has scientists and nonscientists as part of the committee. When you make this choice, a researcher must present written proof of the IRB’s approval, or proof of exemption, of their study before they can access your data for their research.
ds_patient_limit_non_commercial_exp: If you choose this limit, it means the patient’ data may NOT be used by any researcher to do studies to develop a drug, treatment, or device that might later be sold to make a profit. For example, if you choose this limitation, a drug development company (biotech or pharmaceutical) would not be allowed to access or use the patient’s data for research to develop a drug, treatment, or device that they will sell.
ds_patient_limit_irb_exp: If you choose this limit, it means that only researchers that have had their studies reviewed by an Institutional Review Board (IRB) may access the patient’s data for their research. An IRB is a type of committee that reviews research studies and methods to make sure they are not harmful to people. Most of the people who are on an IRB have professional expertise to be able to review the research. The IRB has scientists and nonscientists as part of the committee. When you make this choice, a researcher must present written proof of the IRB’s approval, or proof of exemption, of their study before they can access the patient’s data for their research.
ds_general_research:
General Research
This is the broadest type of research. When you choose General Research researchers may use your data for:

a. Health/Medical/Biomedical Research
Researchers can access and use your data to learn more about a health condition, its causes, symptoms, progression and treatments. This type of research could include research on any health condition, even if it is not a rare disease.

and



b. Other kinds of studies that are not related to health such as

  • Research on age, race, and ethnicity
  • Research studying traits such as how long people live or how easily they may get sick
  • Research about genetic traits of different populations
  • Studies to develop survey questions to improve research
or
ds_h_m_b_research:
Health/Medical/Biomedical Research
This type of research is narrower than type 1, General Research. If you choose just Health/Medical/Biomedical Research, your data may be used for fewer types of research studies than if you choose General Research.
  • Your data may only be used to learn more about a health condition, its cause, symptoms, progression, and treatments. (Research described in section 1.a above)
  • Your data will not be used for other kinds of studies not related to health described in section 1.b above.
ds_patient_h_m_b_research:
Health/Medical/Biomedical Research
This type of research is narrower than type 1, General Research. If you choose just Health/Medical/Biomedical Research, the patient's data may be used for fewer types of research studies than if you choose General Research.
  • The patient's data may only be used to learn more about a health condition, its cause, symptoms, progression, and treatments. (Research described in section 1.a above)
  • The patient's data will not be used for other kinds of studies not related to health described in section 1.b above.
data_sharing_contacted_when_available: You will be contacted when this option is available.
data_sharing_please_choose_above: Please choose one of the above options.
data_sharing_biospecimen_data_connection: Do you know if there are biological samples that you have given for research purposes?
data_sharing_biospecimen_samples_located: If you remember, please list the name of the study, the researcher or the location of the biosample collection
data_sharing_biospecimen_interested: Are you interested in the collection of biological samples for research (saliva/spit, blood, bodily fluids, etc)? *
data_sharing_medical_record_collection_i: Are you interested in having your medical records connected to the data you provide on RARE-X? *
parent_data_sharing_medical_record_colle: Are you interested in having the patient's medical records connected to the data you provide on RARE-X? *
data_sharing_other_data_sources_interest: We know that you may have participated in other studies/data collection. Are you interested in having the data from those studies connected to your data in RARE-X? *
data_sharing_other_data_sources_list_of_: If you remember, please list the name of the study/studies, the researcher(s) or the location(s) of the study (studies).
This field should not be empty
data_sharing_pags_want_to_share: Do you want to share your contact information with patient advocacy groups that support your diagnosis(s)?
parent_data_sharing_pags_want_to_share: Do you want to share the patient's contact information (name/email) with any patient advocacy groups that support your diagnosis(s)?
